txt.en: 'I have said all I can, and now the rule of Rohan will be mine alone. It is a heavy burden. I hope to live up to my uncle's example, but it will not be easy. Still, I will do my best for the people of Rohan!\n\n'Thank you, [placeholder]. I am ready now to depart.'
Talk to Éomer
Pick up the torch
'I bestow the honour on to you to light the pyre.'
Light the pyre
'I would like to honour Snowmane. Come.'
Speak with Éomer on the Pelennor.
'I must go to the city to pay my respects to King Théoden. Join me.'
'Come, Théoden rests near the throne.'
'This has been a long night.'
'We could all use some rest before we march.'
Enter the Tower of Ecthelion with Éomer
Talk to Éomer
Walk with Éomer to Théoden's bedside
'We have arrived, [placeholder]. My heart is full of sorrow, but I would look upon my uncle's visage and think upon his life and deeds even so.'
Pick up the torch for lighting the pyre.
<rgb=#FF0000>Mourn</rgb> for Théoden King
There is little time to mourn those lost at Pelennor, but Aragorn knows that some time must be spared to remember the fallen.

'This is never easy, [placeholder], but it is important. If we are to go on, we must take some time to remember those we have lost. These men died for Gondor, for Rohan, for every land in which dwell the good-hearted. We have constructed a great pyre, and by its light we will remember our fallen.\n\n'Will you accept the task, and the honour, of lighting the pyre? Once it is burning we will begin.'
Use the torch to light the pyre.
The night is lit by the fire of the burning pyre
Enter the Tower of Ecthelion.
Speak with Éomer inside the Tower of Ecthelion.
Talk to Éomer
TBD
Walk with Éomer to pay respects to Théoden.
Pay your respects to Théoden King.
So many good men have died
Speak with Éomer at the Tower of Ecthelion.
Éomer motions that he wishes to speak to you
Listen to the record of the fallen
<rgb=#FF0000>Mourn</rgb> the loss of your fellow warriors
The torch burns brightly in the night
The light of the pyre illuminates the crowd of upturned faces
TBD
Light the pyre
Talk to Éomer
Listen to Éomer as he speaks the names of the fallen.
Place the stone on the cairn for Snowmane
Pick up the stone for Snowmane's cairn
Place the stone of Snowmane's resting place
You are overcome by the loss of many great warriors.
'Morning has come. Let us return to the city and climb to the Citadel. I would visit my uncle where he lies in state, and pay my respects to him.'
Remain alert while Éomer speaks
Speak with Éomer on the Pelennor.
Talk to Éomer
Pick up the stone for Snowmane's cairn.
Place the stone on the cairn that marks Snowmane's grave.

'The pyre will burn until morning, and the heat of the burning will carry our grief into the night sky.\n\n'There is another creature of nobility we should remember: Snowmane, the steed of the king. Come, let us mark the spot where he died and we have buried him.'
Listen to Éomer speak.
'I am ready to depart. We should find what rest we can before our next tasks begin.'
Speak with Éomer on the Pelennor.
Instance: Mourning the Dead
